Pre-Game Insights: India, after a bright start to their Asia Cup 2022 campaign, have succumbed to two disappointing losses in the Super 4 stage.
Despite the likes of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma finding some form in recent matches, their bowling unit has blown hot and cold.
Afghanistan's bowling attack, led by Rashid Khan, should make for a riveting contest in Dubai.
Although they will start as underdogs, Afghan's bowling attack, led by Rashid Khan, should make for a riveting contest in Dubai.
Deepak Chahar has replaced Avesh Khan in the squad.
No changes are expected in Afghanistan's team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is set to take place at 7:30 PM IST.
The live score & commentary of the game can be followed in the Sportskeeda Live Score section.
The pitch in Dubai is a good one to bat on, with the last three matches here seeing first-innings scores of 175, 181, and 173, all of which were chased down as well.
Spin will have a say in the outcome of the match, with the previous game seeing 41 percent of the wickets being taken by the spinners.
Chasing has been the norm at the venue and will be the preferred choice yet again.
Others: The third match of the Super 4 stage of the Asia Cup 2022 featuring India and Afghanistan will be played on September 8 at the Dubai International Cricket Ground.
